I have the same kind of issue though used MonitoredTrainingSession.
In other similar issues, someone suggested to use the default value of num_tokens, code show as below.

sync_opt = tf.train.SyncReplicasOptimizer(
            optimizer,
            replicas_to_aggregate=num_workers,
            total_num_replicas=num_workers)

sync_replicas_hook = sync_opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief, num_tokens=0)

If num_tokens=0, the program will raise CancelledError Exception.
If code changed to like this, the program will be terminated normally. but distributed model couldn't sync.

sync_replicas_hook = sync_opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief)

I want to know the reason and how to avoid the exception.

body:
I have the same kind of issue though used MonitoredTrainingSession. 
In other similar issues, someone suggested to use the default value of num_tokens, code show as below.
```
sync_opt = tf.train.SyncReplicasOptimizer(
            optimizer,
            replicas_to_aggregate=num_workers,
            total_num_replicas=num_workers)

sync_replicas_hook = sync_opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief, num_tokens=0)
```
If `num_tokens=0`, the program will raise **CancelledError** Exception. 
If code changed to like this, the program will be terminated normally. but distributed model couldn't sync.
```
sync_replicas_hook = sync_opt.make_session_run_hook(is_chief)
```
I want to know the reason and how to avoid the exception.
